node.text:
New photography book 'Haçienda Landscapes' – which explores the modern myth and magic of the Manchester club – has launched on Kickstarter.

Here, watch designer Ben Kelly (@the.photo.kid) and photographer (@eugene_schlumberger) discuss the project, and head to wallpaper.com to read more about it.

Film: Max Smith
#WallpaperMagazine #design #clubculture #books #kickstarter #Hacienda #BenKelly #photography

node.text:
Maserati's first mild hybrid electric vehicle, the Ghibli Hybrid combines intense power and reduced fuel consumption and emissions with the pure exhilaration of driving a Maserati. In the Ghibli Hybrid, Maserati has created something of beauty, power and audacity that also has a meaningful impact on our present.

@maseratigb #Maserati #MaseratiGhibliHybrid #SparkTheNext

node.text:
K11 MUSEA in Hong Kong has deployed 11 autonomous robot cleaners. 🤖

Armed with sterilising solution that’s proven to eliminate 99.99% of germs and viruses, you can spot the autonomous robots spraying and sanitising the air and every nook and cranny of K11 MUSEA, which is set to reopen at midday tomorrow (6 March).

Here, watch as they sanitise the 340,000 sq ft @K11Musea premises, and have some fun once the day’s work is done.

Read more about the design behind the K11 art and retail complex at wallpaper.com.

@AdrianCheng #WallpaperMagazine #design #film

node.text:
Bosco Sodi (@studioboscosodi)'s paintings are often monumental in scale – the titular piece of his breakthrough show, Pangaea at the Bronx Museum (2010) measured 4m x 12m – so it may come as a surprise that the artist prefers to work by himself.⁠
⁠
We visited Sodi's studio in September 2020 to discover his creative process, witnessing the mixing of his paints (made from personally-sourced pigments, sawdust, glue and water), and the unique process by which he creates his work. Lying the canvases flat atop upturned buckets, he throws on fistfuls of paints with his bare hands, splattering layer upon layer over a four to five day period.⁠
⁠
‘And when I see the first crack, I stop totally and let the painting go by itself,' he explains. 'Because if I get into the painting when it’s already becoming alive, it would not have that natural and organic feeling.’⁠
⁠
Learn more in our studio profile on wallpaper.com⁠
⁠(Video by @spenciv and @peterelliotteaton⁠)
⁠
#boscosodi @cacmalaga @kasmingallery @pioneerworks #painting #contemporaryart #wallpapermagazine

node.title: In the studio with artist Bosco Sodi

node.text:
Initiated and carried out against the backdrop of a global pandemic, ‘Connected’ – Benchmark’s (@madebybenchmark) latest collaborative project with the American Hardwood Export Council (@ahec_europe) – has seen nine designers come up with something that would enhance their working-from-home experience. The obvious twist is that they have been unable to visit the workshop or see their pieces in the flesh, and have instead relied on a lot of Zoom calls, countless WhatsApp conversations, and a good helping of trust.

Nine designers chose from three woods to work with: red oak, maple and cherry. The material, as well as the lockdown, appears to have reignited an appreciation for the natural world in the designers. From Thomas Heatherwick’s maple planters, CNC-carved using an algorithm based on biomimicry and providing welcome greenery at his new London home, to Studiopepe’s ‘Pink Moon’ chair based on lunar movement, ‘each designer has drawn on nature in order to feel closer to it.

Read more at wallpaper.com, via link in bio. 

#wallpapermagazine #americanhardwood #connectedbydesign

@designmuseum @officialheatherwickstudio @studiopepe_official @iniarchibong @jaimehayon @sebastianherkner @studio_swine @mariajeglinska @bruundesign @sabine_marcelis

node.text:
Acerbis

As the new art directors of Italian brand @acerbis_design, Francesco Meda and David Lopez Quincoces spent time delving into the archive, uncovering classic pieces from bygone collections.

Their findings are presented in this film, Sinestesia, which is shot entirely on 16mm and produced manually without any filters or digital effects, as a nod to the decades-long roots of these visionary designs. Drawing on the neurological phenomena Synesthesia, the film visualises the sensations of shapes, colors, and sounds seen throughout the collection.

‘Objects possess a life of their own — more than a mere unity of materials, every creation engenders a universe of emotions, history, and the ideas that produced it,’ they say.

Read more at acerbisdesign.com

#design #acerbisdesign #film #designfilm

@acerbis_design @francescomeda @quincocesdrago @ps.designconsultants

Credits

Art Direction & Design: Francesco Meda, David Lopez Quincoces
Video director: Lorenzo Gironi
Creative Direction: Mattia Orso Mangano

node.text:
This season @akrisofficial opted to present its collection as a short film, directed by Anton Corbijn.

A meditative escape into luminescence, it echoes the fluorescent pieces in Akris’ S/S 2021 collection. Think: easy silk knit dresses, parkas and jogging bottoms - relaxed shapes which also speak of an effortless ease. They are charged symbols of collaboration and creativity, illuminating how fashion can dilute a year defined by darkness. ‘Clothes will remain powerful vectors to cheer us up, to soothe and to strengthen us,’ says creative director Albert Kriemler. ‘To help you drive forward.’ 

For the collection, Kriemler was inspired by German artist Imi Knoebel - a pioneer of multi disciplinary minimalist abstract art. ‘I was always fascinated by the way Knoebel dares to develop new hues,’ Kriemler adds. ‘He shares Matisse’s desire to “make colour sing” or as I would rephrase it: He lets colour shine.’

Read more about the collection and its inspirations on wallpaper.com, and on akris.com.

@antoncorbijn4real #akris #fashion #wallpapermagazine #film #antoncorbijn

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wallpaper* in Milan, Italy with @bebitalia, and @monicaarmani. May be an image of saddle-stitched leather.

node.text:
Monica Armani looked back to the 1960s for her latest designs for B&B Italia (@bebitalia).⁠
⁠
Seen here ahead of their presentation at Salone del Mobile (@isaloniofficial), her new family of ‘Allure O’ tables and small ‘Flair O’ armchairs evoke the glamour of the era, and as their names suggest, one of the decade’s most famous style icons, Jackie O. ‘I love her glamorous style; it’s always precise, never excessive,’ explains @monicaarmani. ‘She’s the interpreter of what I consider true luxury: the search for detail, harmony and balance.’ ⁠
⁠
Recalling the elliptical geometric shapes of the designer’s 2017 ‘Madison’ mirror, itself inspired by Jackie O’s signature sunglasses, the new series of tables and armchair feature similarly graceful and sinuous lines.⁠
⁠
Find out more about the collaboration via the link in bio.⁠
⁠
📸 Artwork: @studio_likeness⁠
⁠
#Bebitalia #MonicaArmani #SuperSalone21 #SalonedelMobile #SuperSalone #Fuorisalone #MilanDesignWeek #WallpaperMagazine ⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Wallpaper* on August 31, 2021 tagging @flexformspa. May be an image of sofa and living room.

node.text:
Antonio Citterio’s delicate and welcoming sofa for Flexform (@flexformspa) has innately elegant appeal.⁠
⁠
To be presented during Salone del Mobile 2021 (@isaloniofficial), ‘Harper’ is designed for a medley of different uses, and works in harmony, just like the musical instrument it is named after. What really sets the sofa apart is a distinctive console armrest, made of thin metal sheet clad in leather. Combined with generously padded modular seats, it can be configured to fit to perfection whatever the space available. ⁠
⁠
Find out more about the collaboration, and explore our full guide to Salone del Mobile and Fuorisalone at wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠
⁠
📸 Artwork: @studio_likeness⁠
⁠
#Flexform #AntonioCitterio #SuperSalone21 #SalonedelMobile #SuperSalone #Fuorisalone #MilanDesignWeek  #WallpaperMagazine ⁠
⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wallpaper* in Milan, Italy.

node.text:
After an 18-month hiatus, Salone del Mobile (@isaloniofficial) returns on 5-10 September to Milan.  Dubbed ‘Supersalone’, the 2021 edition of the fair, curated by architect Stefano Boeri, will be an immersive, unique design event.⁠
⁠
Presented with an innovative modular and flexible exhibition design led by Andrea Caputo, Supersalone will see companies show their best work from the past 18 months: a unique and special moment to discover today’s design panorama. ⁠
⁠
Newly conceived presentations this year include 'The Lost Graduation Show' which showcases the work of emerging designers, and ‘The Makers Show’, a curated display by independent workshops, studios, laboratories and start-ups celebrating craftsmanship and innovation.⁠
⁠
Read our full expert guide to navigating Salone del Mobile (and Fuorisalone) at wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠
⁠
#SuperSalone21 #SalonedelMobile #SuperSalone #Fuorisalone #MilanDesignWeek #WallpaperMagazine ⁠

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Wallpaper* in Verde Creek. May be an image of furniture, tree and living room.

node.text:
Discreetly tucked away in a creek bend, Verde Creek Residence is a tranquil retreat that creates the experience of discovering a hidden clearing between towering trees and a rocky hillside in Comfort, Texas. ⁠
⁠
Designed by studio Lake Flato, the extraordinary escape emerged after the clients approached the American architecture practice having been long-time friends and supporters of their work.⁠
⁠
Read more via link in bio, at wallpaper.com. ⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #design #architecture #LakeFlato #Texas #interiordesign

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Wallpaper* on August 29, 2021 tagging @g.binsky. May be an image of 1 person and jewelry.

node.text:
With the spotlight firmly on sustainability, a host of jewellers are taking a closer look at their production processes and rethinking the materials they use for contemporary rings, necklaces and bracelet. By utilising materials that already exist, rather than creating something new, offcuts destined for landfill are finding new life.⁠
⁠
Brazilian designer Gabriela Bins, is the jeweller behind @g.binsky, a brand which celebrates imperfect silhouettes and sculptural forms. Her jewellery, pictured here, is crafted from ceramic and forms organic curves around the ear and neck, playing with proportions for bold and joyful adornments.⁠
⁠
Discover more jewellery brands breaking the mould on wallpaper.com, via the link in bio.⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #SustainableJewellery #Sustainability #Cermamics #JewelleryDesign⁠

node.text:
When a south London family of four decided to upgrade their Balham house into an expansive home with extra living space, an indoor swimming pool and a sauna, they turned to emerging architects Jaam, luxury specialist @mascotbespoke, and joinery expert @blakesldn for help. ⁣
⁣
Now, the house, a Victorian property redesign called Nightingale Triangle, has just been completed – sporting a striking wood clad extension that cuts a distinctly contemporary figure within its sleepy residential neighbourhood. ⁣
⁣
‘Glazed expanses mix with timber, original brick and soft fabrics to create a home that is both comfortable and modern. The swimming pool, located off the side of the building, features a cleverly angled ceiling that promotes a cosy, cave-like feel, while also allowing views out to the verdant garden.⁣
⁣
Read more at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁠⁣
⁣
⁠#WallpaperMagazine #Architecture #LondonHouses #Balham #LondonArchitecture

node.text:
Bottega Veneta creative director Daniel Lee is fascinated by the concept of transforming banal clothing items using exuberant materials – cue dressing gown coats in eye-catching bottle-green faux fur and denim jackets shimmering with metal studs. He’s applied the same sensibility to a pair of high-top trainers, which boast a speedy set of wheels. These are not just for the roller disco, but for day-to-night activities that require accelerated self-expression.⁠
⁠
For more fashion news, see the link in bio as well as our September 2021 Issue, on newsstands now, and available to download at wallpaper.com.⁠
⁠
⁠
📸: @oskar.proctor⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #fashion #bottegaveneta #rollerskates #daniellee #rollerskatestyle⁠

node.text:
Fogo Island Workshops present a new collection of furniture curated by Anniina Koivu and featuring designs in wood by Anthony Guex, Adrien Rovero and Wataru Kumano. A remote island in Canada’s Newfoundland, @fogoislandinn is described as ‘a place of hard rock and cold winds. It is not a place for whim and fancy or waste and indulgence. Living here means being resourceful: making things that work and last.’ ⁠
⁠
The pieces reflect the harsh conditions and the spirit of adaptation that is typical of the land. ‘Things have a purpose and people have an everyday wisdom, which makes them incredibly practical, independent and real: there is a problem to solve, so you solve it,’ adds Koivu, a Finnish design critic, educator and curator who was invited to interpret the essence of Fogo Island through this furniture collection. ⁠
⁠
Read more at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁠
⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #FogoIslandWorkshops #design #furniture #canada

node.text:
While travelling around the British countryside, chances are you will come across a flock of colourful sheep in a field at some point in your journey. A familiar sight for country folks, and a colourful surprise for others, smit marks – the spray- painted patches on the sheep – are commonly used by shepherds in the UK to identify animals in their herd.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
The chromatic custom is also the starting point for Peter Saville’s Technicolour collection of upholstery textiles, rugs and curtains created in collaboration with @kvadrattextiles and presented at Salone del Mobile and Copenhagen’s 3 Days of Design, in September 2021. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Read more about the collaboration at wallpaper.com, via link in bio. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #Kvadrat #PeterSaville ⁠⁠
 #salonedelmobile #design #wool #technicolour⁠⁠

node.text:
The Wondrous Brewing Company’s new headquarters in Emeryville, San Francisco Bay Area, is a minimalist brewery that celebrates craft beer.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Completed by multidisciplinary firm Garcia Tamjidi Architecture Design, the project is a contemporary mix of large stainless steel brewing tanks, refrigeration areas and grain grinding zones. Originally an empty industrial warehouse, ‘the change in use to a brewery required a seismic upgrade of the building and all new concrete floor slab to support the weight of the extraordinarily heavy tanks’ explains the American architecture practice’s principal Farid Tamjidi.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Read more on tap at wallpaper.com, via link in bio.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #design #architecture #craftbeer #brewery #sanfrancisco

node.text:
The brainchild of owners Adrian and Megan Corrigall and RAW Architecture Workshop, Concrete House is a stylish, brutalist family home that balances rich textures at a domestic scale. The ambition of the project was to create a minimalist dwelling ’that retained honesty and simplicity in both material use and in how its occupants use its spaces’ explains Adrian Corrigall. ⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Nestled in rich architectural gardens in Lewes, East Sussex, the scheme feels both solid and dramatic with its large openings, sleek furniture, and strategic surfaces.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
Explore it in full via link in bio, at wallpaper.com.⁠⁠
⁠⁠
#WallpaperMagazine #architecture #design #pool #eastsussex

node.text:
A tribute to his Trinidadian roots and self-described mix of ‘West Indian elegance and sex appeal’, Maximilian Davis’ (@_mvximilian_) breakout collection featured cut-out dresses and silky shirts inspired by the 19th-century carnival outfits of Trinidad and Tobago. His latest offering, pictured here, takes its cues from his⁠
grandma’s Sunday best closet and 1960s space fashion. ⁠
⁠
Find out more about Davis’ collection, as well as five other up-and-coming labels, via the link in bio, as well as our September 2021 Issue, on newsstands now, and available to download at wallpaper.com.⁠
